vFb50H8URSLcApLQQF2umw.text: We went as a group of 4 adults and 9 kids aged 3-8. It's really hard to find a restaurant in which you can really enjoy the food, find decent food for the children (which is more than a burger and chips), fast service and friendly atmosphere. This place has it all. The pizza and pasta were superior, the wine was great, the waiters were extremely friendly and efficient and altogether we had a wonderful experience. Something about this place just works and you can feel it in the air. And at the end of the meal, we paid 60 pounds per family (including wine and dessert), a very reasonable price. Highly recommended!

HSmtAen8ckqamz-WMJJDgg.text: Very good food. Not the best pizza I've ever had, but very flavorful (had the Napoletana).Staff was friendly, if overwhelmed by the volume of customers on a Saturday night.Wine selection is very good. Had a doppio with tiramisu. Coffee was very good. Tiramisu was not. I've made better at home. Didn't taste like rum or coffee (should taste like both). Very meh.

l71IRoW1VrfWRSLh2FLOIw.text: Good value and very good food.  The Rocca near the Victoria and Albert Museum was popular and fun.  The Pasta Bolognese was terrific.

Kgi_fGgEdg1Of5a7WIkOuA.text: These guys completely exceeded my expectations. In South Ken needing a quick pizza fix, they made me a pizza in the 8 minute timeframe promised. And surprisingly delicious it was too: fresh tomato passata (as opposed to a pre-prepared sauce stuffed with unwelcome sweeteners and herbs), strips of anchovies and slices of mozzarella sparingly spread on a perfectly cooked (just between soggy and crispbread) base. I'm a huge pizza fan and buy it quite regularly, but was still very pleasantly surprised by the pizza here. The pizzas are quite small, but I think this is more than compensated for by the low price (starting at £5.40 for a margherita) and the unusually high quality. I'll be back.

Re0qzaLgCSJeuWbysrAB5w.text: Well, a relatively new restaurant in South Kensington. What a treat . . . I went along with my wife and two good friends (whose taste in food is impeccable) who had recommended this place to my wife and I on several occasions. And, it must be said, whose taste in food, pubs and restaurants I have yet to fault. We had all been out together for a social drink (not a session) and had decided to go out to eat and that we'd try Rocca - especially as my friends had pressed us. Where to start: the wine list inexpensive and unimpressive, acceptable and uninspired. As a rating: a solid "Yawn". Ah "the food?" I hear you cry - well . . . I'll not be going there again in any hurry and I certainly won't be recommending it to anyone, and, given the contents of the "vongole" I won't be recommending it to the dog either! My friend had a Pizza which was, in his words, quite acceptable. My friend's wife has a pasta dish (spaghetti) with a vongole sauce. It went back as being slightly underdone and it had grit in it. Gee guys - you're supposed to wash the clams - the grit is not seasoning or flavouring. Damn lucky she didn't break a tooth. I had a Carbonara and the pasta was - quite simply - very undercooked. Now I've lived in restaurants all my life, my grandfather had them, my father had them and I've run them. I can put a carbonara together in my sleep - which is why I always order it in a new Italian as my "benchmark" dish. Well - too much cream, no egg yolk, and the pasta half raw. Called over the waiter who took it away with a loud grumble (that and the Vongole) and then returned, - and from the other side of the restaurant - proceeded to instruct me in the nuances of "al dente" pasta - idiot. I've forgotten more about a professional kitchen than he will ever know. But one thing's for sure - Rocca does NOT think that the customer is always right. Carbonara not good - far from it. Tiramisu to follow - probably bought-in and if it wasn't then it was a truly dire homemade attempt. My wife had Bolognese which was - I am happy to say this (because I tried it - so disbelieving was I ). It is/was EXCELLENT. Not as good as my Mother's (nor is my own) but it was CLOSE, yeah - probably as good as mine - or damn near it. Oh yes, and the prtion size IS goodHowever I will avoid the place from now on and I suggest you do too. Spend you money well in Spagos (literally around the corner) where - if you do send your food back (I never have in 30 years) - they will apologise and sort it out and not include it on the bill (as Rocca did). They're getting two stars because the Bolognese was BRILLIANT. But for that Bolognese they'd get one star, and that grudgingly. Me? Not know what 'al dente' is? My god . . . to even suggest the customer doesn't know what he's talking about. Hey, if they don't improve they won't be there next year . . .

6Wq5pAGmn94qAFoFQbhntw.text: During our visit here, we had the absolute WORST experience ever. Starting with our rude waitress to just okay Italian food. To start with the ending of story, I spent most of the late night and earlier AM sick from the lasagna I ate from here.When we arrived to Rocca for dinner, I approached the waitress outside about obtaining a table for two. She told me that she will look inside to see if any tables opened up; however, she quickly disregarded looking for any available tables and I watched her just stand at the front of the restaurant doing nothing. It was about 5 minutes later that a nicer gentlemen came out to help us with a table. After he looked throughout the restaurant and noted no available tables for two, we waited about 10 minutes for a table.Once seated we waited over 15 minutes until the waitress first came to us. This would not have normally bothered me, but I saw the three parties seated after us all place their orders before we were even acknowledged. The only positive thing was we did receive our meals extremely fast. Like mentioned above, I ordered the lasagna and the other person I was with ordered the spaghetti. The spaghetti was very chewy and mushy, definitely not al dente. We also ordered a small salad with the meal, but we never received the salad. After already eating a portion of the meal, the waitress came back to the table. I told her we didn't receive the salad and her response was "why?". I was caught off guard to her response because clearly the reason why is that they never brought it out with our entrees. When we told her not to worry about it and just take it off the bill since we had been almost half way through eating, she got in my face arguing with me over it! She was extremely rude the whole time. After asking nicely to take it off and it was no big deal, she never came back once to our table, and we had to ask the nice gentlemen for the check and we just paid with him. As for the food, like I said I got sick (definitely food poisoning) from my lasagna. This was the only thing I ate all day that could have gotten me sick like this! At the table next to us, one of the men sent his pizza back 3 times due to it being undercooked. Finally on the last try, they provided him with a cooked pizza. This was my first time to Rocca and will be my last. I read all these great reviews about the restaurant and was excited to try it. It is a shame, but South Kensington has other great restaurants that I will be dining at from now on.

tUBOAn8bIl1d6TwrT3Lx1w.text: I think this is the sort of place that South Kensington has been missing: an open and inviting, yet polished-feeling establishment featuring clean design and a straight-forward Italian menu.  I was walking past a couple weeks after it'd opened, and couldn't help but feel the pull of the warm wood and brick interior and the appealing-sounding offerings of everything from antipasti to pasta.Since I was starting to feel my stomach grumble, I wandered inside for a late lunch.  I was immediately charmed by the single green apple that accented every table.  Once I'd ordered, the dish containing the apple was replaced with a little tray of complimentary olives.  Now, if you've read any of the rest of my reviews, then you know that I'm obsessed with olives... so hurrah! - I was beginning to like this place already!Following the olives and a rather large glass of the house red, I was brought a bowl of tomato soup and a basket of bread (not complimentary - but with the UK catching onto the anti-carbs craze, this is smart of them).  Honestly, I was disappointed by both.  The tomato soup had sounded enticing with its addition of "basil cream" (hmm.. I'd wondered... what is *that* - unfortunately, I'm still wondering since from what I could tell, it wasn't there... or at least not enough to bother mentioning) and was quite watery - nothing more substantial or special than what you'd get from a can.  The bread was a mix of some rather boring white rolls, and dry focaccia... *sigh*... when I spring for the bread, especially focaccia, I expect it to be *good.*But the staff was very nice, and very concerned that I had a good visit (understandably)... I'm going to give them the benefit of the doubt since I didn't try any of their mains and they had cute apples on the table... not to mention that it was only their first couple of weeks.  As I said, I'd like to succeed since I feel S. Kens needs an attractive place like this... so I'll go back before I cast a firm verdict.

photos.caption: Photo of Rocca - London, United Kingdom. Rocca Interior
Photo of Rocca - London, United Kingdom

WwG3vE9ougzao7TJyvIBrg.text: The pizza at this place is fantastic, and the service was also some of the best of Britain. The pasta was very good but a tad over cooked and a little under seasoned. What was amazing though was the price. This was probably the best value restaurant in the south Kensington area and if you don't put it on your list you're a fool. Dress for the heat though because if you're in the back that kitchen is HOT!

eJc76vTzD31lJqIdZbkgUg.text: Not a 5, but pretty darn close for nice and relaxed in South Ken.  Loved the place, went there several times.  The whole package makes it a great stop where I would go back again, gladly.

T_m7wqUSCTJIfddZlczJLQ.text: Needed a quick dinner before a show on a Saturday and got here around 5:30pm. Luckily we did as most tables seemed to be booked for 6 or 7pm. There were already a fair number of tables occupied. The staff were all very Italian and the feel of the restaurant was good. The Food range is excellent and we battled to choose between pizza or pasta and ended up each getting one. The food was excellent and very fresh. The wine choice was large enough to cover all tastes including "by the glass". Good value as well would recommend.

OMZ6h0lEEO4Ek9Wj22C7qA.text: This is one of the worse italian restaurants I have ever been. The service and the atmosphere were OK, but the food was simply very low quality. The beef of the carpaccio was one of the worst quality dishes I have had. The pizza was too humid and mushy and the quality of the olive oil was very low.

nss2VMUe8gR7VFggtwdjBQ.text: What a delightful traditional Italian restaurant! This was my first time eating here and the next time I am in the area I will be back!Not only is the food first rate so to is the service and the bill.. cheap as chips which is quite surprising considering the area.I highly recommend you give this place a try!

DXhghl5VeepYOkgZBDRwtA.text: Delicious and so reasonable! I had the spinach & ricotta tortellini, which was super fresh, as well as a caprese salad, some rosemary cheesy bread, and a delicious blood orange tart of some kind. Our server was super friendly, the atmosphere was great, and I would go back in a second.

qqIh4qtadeixqkPvHTKL3g.text: Went to Rocca on the Old Brompton Road this week. We had starters, main courses and deserts with a bottle of wine and the bill came to £52 for two people, very reasonable given the location food was very good, as was the service. And they dont automatically add on service charge to the bill (one of my pet hates) Will definitely go back

ScIokt27MsBj9EUTx8aXsQ.text: I wandered in while visiting London, and I was really impressed. Food is excellent (had ravioli and my daughter had a pizza), and the prices are very reasonable. It's a nice place to sit, and the staff is running around in a friendly way.  We also split a salad and some type of fried appetizer, both of which were excellent.

u_vh1XZ0XCLk9cXKAMiEmQ.text: My friend and I wandered in here for a late dinner on Saturday night around 9:30 PM, looking for a quick bite and after seeing that Franco Manca down the road still had a long queue waiting outside. By comparison, we walked into Rocca and a table was prepared for us immediately, and we placed our order within minutes. We asked our server if a pizza was big enough to share between 2 people; she said that it was 4 slices, so we ordered two, but in hindsight, one would really have been enough. They are the size of an extremely large dinner plate, and I'm not sure what size slices she was referring to, but it was many more than 4 in my mind. I got the funghi, which had many different types of mushrooms and was exceptionally tasty, and my friend got the ventricina, which also looked good. We also shared the bruschetta al pomodoro and a bottle of the barbera red wine. The food was great and the service also excellent. I would definitely drop by again.

wnsqwDljuFHRoHHzeBdLNw.text: Outstanding Italian restaurant.  Great food, lively atmosphere, and reasonable menu prices. Tagliatelle Bolognese was a perfect meal after a long travel day. Pizzas are personal size but big on taste. Went on consecutive nights. Highly recommend in the South Kensington area.

dyrSC0uwppNkcCluxx2Pww.text: hmmmm this felt more like a diner and def not a proud italian one.... the food was just ok, but noting special.

J69D8tc41cUFlk1iz8NQbg.text: Rocca di Papa was a great choice for an enjoyable, Saturday lunch. Showing up towards the beginning of lunch service meant we had our pick of the liter of seating, and an almost empty front patio. The restaurant is in the perfect location for spotting some of the more exotic cars of London, as within an hour I spotted multiple Ferraris, Aston Martins, and too many Maseratis to keep track of. That being said, the menu is fairly priced, and shouldn't leave a hole in your wallet. To start the meal I sat down with an Americano, which didn't disappoint. Next was the calamari as an appetizer, with my only complaint being that I wish there was more on the plate! Very good, and obviously fresh. This was all brought out quite briskly by the waiters and waitresses, who worked in tangent to bring out parts of the meal. Now onto the meat (or chorizo) of the review. Both myself and my dining partner ordered pizza off the menu. I myself ordered the Iberica, while he ordered the Prosciutto. Sitting on the plate it looked more like a piece of art than a pizza pie, but as voracious as I was it didn't stay that way for long. The sauce was delicious, and complimented the chorizo on the pizza quite well. However, the crust was the best part, being crunchy yet not flakey, and held some serious flavor. The Prosciutto was reported to me to taste quite nice as well, with the crust once again receiving rave reviews. After all was said and done, another Americano was poured and a dish of chocolate gelato was served, while a waiter pushed up the shade of the terrace to let in some more of the suns rays. The rich flavor of the gelato left me more than satisfied as we left to explore more of London's sights and sounds.I highly recommend Rocca to anybody looking for a £20 lunch in the South Kensington area. The pizza was top notch, the coffee was well above average, and  both were accompanied with an enjoyable atmosphere and friendly waitstaff.

pynK6r9KO_DeuUR63T2EFQ.text: The food, for the price you pay is great. Pizza is the way to go here for cheap eats, the lasagne is a solid decent one. The service is, neglectful, however they are very busy and don't take bookings for small groups. The bathrooms could have done with a little more attention from the staff, and the queue of customers would perhaps go down a little quicker if there was only one staff member attending to them, not three. I would give this only 3 stars, however the price was too good, I would certainly go back again and recommend it to a friend in the area.

exS9s1RWAEbzO1U4KSH7PQ.text: Good Italian food, my pasta was a little too aldente but it was still a great atmosphere and I was with a party of six and there was no wait. It was a nice experience and very reasonably priced, nothing too special though.

yQLaUPN0LlmqbDHqc8HCNQ.text: Nice italian restaurant. Been here three times with my wife and two kids. The kids love this place. Very popular. It is been full each time. A bit noisy, but a great atmosphere. Will definitely come here again.

D1H-VewC9dzgcXY-xw5pfg.text: This place was fantastic; excellent wine selection with very reasonable prices on the bottle.  Food was the best I've had outside of Italy; the pasta tasted homemade and the pesto sent me back to Genoa.  Highly recommend!

hZxF_9OHPOeei4R5F5bLNA.text: "Pricey South Kensington - Not on your nelly!"Reviewed 21 January 2014Getting a bit hungry in South Kensington? Fantastic Lush Americana Pizza served with a smile - £8. DONE!Visited January 20144 of 5 stars Value4 of 5 stars Atmosphere5 of 5 stars Service4 of 5 stars Food

MlPKE2D8D5W5OkyVjRM4Nw.text: Our group of four was on a recent trip to London, felt like having something other than pub food but not too pretentious, found some favorable Yelp reviews for Rocca, and walked over from our hotel.  Very glad we did, and enjoyed our dinner very much.We all had pizzas, and shared a couple bottles of wine.  The pizzas were all quite good, as good as any I've had at Italian restaurants in Europe.  For my fellow Americans, the standard European pizza is a one-person affair, and thin crust style.  The wines were both good, and neither the wine or pizzas were expensive.  In fact, we were pleasantly surprised at the moderate prices especially in London!  You could actually eat here for under £10 per person if you skipped the wino.The restaurant itself is very typical Italian place, not very large with lots of tables crammed in.  Not a good place to go if you want quiet and lots of space, but a very good place if you like a lively atmosphere.  We arrived about 8pm and the restaurant was still quite full, but fortunately we were seated right away as it seemed the groups with children were starting to finish and leave.  The waitresses were good and efficient, friendly without being "in your face".I wish we had returned here for another dinner during our stay.

KaGYOS5jVY4VXHrRQN7o4A.text: Imagine sitting outside on a beautiful night in South Kensington, watching the people walk by, whilst you have an outstanding Italian dinner of rissoto, lasagne, wine, bread, wine and wine. And grappa. Our dinner was excellent. Our server was funny, charming and attentive. In fact, I actually feel like he was too charming (not his fault) because he was taking away some of my swag with my date.  It was all in good fun though. What a great place. And seriously, the bill has half what I thought it was going to be. Wonderful value!

usFah_on6n_TY8zo0Vlogw.text: Love this place, brilliant pasta, nice quite environment, wonderful service. Highly recommend

lrt0JzehTTzAkCrepkYVHQ.text: Fantastic Italian restaurant! Accidentally found it after visiting the museums on Exhibition road. Tasty pasta, wide range of wine and authentic Italian staff. Really enjoyed having dinner there.

elfsAxnaKZZdBtVWH1FxUA.text: Everything was delicious and waiters were very friendly.  My husband is from Italy and upon eating the pizza he said it's the best he's had since the last time he was in Italy!  We will definitely be back here.

GZriRj68_nzr5KvaFV9L1A.text: I came here on a Friday night. The restaurant was packed and it seemed to have a great atmosphere.It took awhile for us to get a table. The guy who was in charge of seating us could have been a bit more accurate with how long our table would be, but he was rushed off his feet so it can be forgiven!The reason for the low score is the food, which I found to be bland. The pizza base was just heavy and had no flavour.

cjEk2kYz8smq86AdFgywOQ.text: I ordered the prosciutto pizza and my husband the bolognese. Both were quite delicious.  Our hotel recommended we take the 2 minute walk to Rocca and it was a great choice after a busy day traveling . it was casual and inviting. Fantastic wine and great food. I noticed many other comments about the service being bad but ours was excellent!

sBBMAuTc36RvGMDUo12L0w.text: Not pretentious Italian restaurant in South Ken (an area populated by a lot of Italians!).On Sunday night the service was very quick, the best thing for a pre cinema dinner with a nice pizza. The pizza is okay, not the best I ever had, but not bad at all in particular with reference to the price. here is the best part: a pizza here costs between £5 and £8, like in Italy! We were 6 people, with a pizza with buffalo mozzarella each, mineral water and coke, a couple of desserts and coffees and we paid around £10 each, amazing!Perfect for a laid back dinner

XbW_EzHP9qkDEiLk3ofavA.text: Really nice Italian restaurant in South Kensington - quite busy.  Really enjoyed the food and the good service - I felt the pizzas could have had a bit more flavour is all (but then, I'm a bit of a pizza snob at times)....soup, wine and dessert were excellent and the prices were perfectly reasonable - everyone was happy.... next time I'm in town, I will try it again....

nmx0EEZ1hufoHUPi_qlPMw.text: The food is very good here, at good prices.  The staff all speak Italian, and it makes the atmosphere more fun.

08SrtXlbfGAnWx8eO1nidg.text: I would give this place 4.5 stars but am rounding up. Food was really excellent. I particularly loved the grilled prawns starter -- best and unique of such I ever had at an Italian place. The grilled veggies and mozzarella / tomato platter were both great too. The starters themselves were enough to get our appetite going. Then came the mains. I ordered the seafood pasta, which interestingly enough, was served in thick udon noodle type of pasta. The seasoning and seafood were good, but unfortunately, the pasta was a bit dry and sticking together. This is where I would dock .5 star. My other friends' dishes all seemed great. They ordered a pizza, lasagna and crab meat pasta, and they all said they really liked their dishes. We were very pleasantly surprised when we got the bill. For the four of us, the total came down to £70, which is a great value in London. Ambience was very nice as well. Modern and sophisticated, it is good for any type of occasion. Service was good and generally prompt, though it got a little difficult to get attention toward the end of the dinner as the restaurant got more crowded. All in all, thumbs up.

RLnXbcJI9OYD_pd3svHhrQ.text: Rocca serves excellent Italian standards at a reasonable price, in a comfortable setting.  I had the tagliatelle bolognese, and the wife had the lasagna.  Both were terrific.  The burratina appetizer was interesting, and good.  The bufala salad could have benefited from better tomatoes, but I'm not sure restaurants in the UK have access to good tomatoes in April.  Service was a little slow as the restaurant was very busy.  But everyone was incredibly friendly and cheerful.  We really enjoyed the experience.

OUet0qCAe3YDkx0w0EGrxg.text: We visited this restaurant today with 4 adults and 2 toddlers. I'd recommend making reservations as we had to wait about 20 minutes to get a table. This is not a child friendly restaurant as there are no high chairs or changing tables in the restrooms and the tables are so close together it is impossible to put your buggy at your table. This left us wrangling two toddlers throughout lunch.The food was very delicious, but the waitress forgot about the wine I had ordered and I had to ask twice for it. Wine was much needed since I was trying to restrain my baby the entire lunch!We ordered pizzas, pasta, bread and some of the most delicious arancini I've ever tasted. I'd give this place a 5/5 for food, but 3/5 due to the incredible difficulty we had bringing our children here.I would go back sans child :)

VgpkUOb5pdFLfxt1Dn_77w.text: Firstly, we are tourists but we try to avoid traps. This place is a short walk from our hotel and we tried it based on another excellent Yelp review from a fellow Texan. I'll just say it was so good that we ate here two nights in a row. Very nice staff and wonderful authentic Italian food. Come here and get treated like a local!

BySWqW1ZUbrE2RbJI1-sPw.text: Pizza is excellent. I had the osso buco ravioli and it was delicious. Atmosphere was nice. Very accommodating for my picky eater 11 year old. I would go back.

SWU-u-b0pRPFvk2UXBSlSA.text: In sum: Really good food. Really horrible service. We had an early dinner at Rocca. While our food (calamari, pizza, cod, chocolate cake) were all quite excellent and perfectly prepared, our dining experience was overshadowed by the fact that our server went AWOL in the middle of our meal. She was really friendly to begin with but perhaps she got angry at one of the other servers who were way too busy flirtling with one another? Supposely there was a shift change going on (at 6 PM?) but we had to flag down different servers for both our dessert order as well as our check.

rd_9oJ4H88jZwyajfaUO2w.text: Food: sorry to say but rather sad italian. More what you'd expect from an American-Italian chain, yet I can think of better ones. My carbonara was below ordinary.  Pasta themselves had less taste than what you can buy at Waitrose.My calamari were just okToilets: pass the testDecor: warm, nice, within the good averageService: lots of waiters who are prompt. The best thing about this restaurant.Nevertheless, will not return

photos.caption: Photo of Rocca - London, United Kingdom. Carbonara I suggest to avoid

MONz83UT2dD0Hq4cOdJzrg.text: We loved this place!  Didn't feel much like venturing out too far in the cold and since this was right in our neighborhood, we took a short walk over, and were so glad we did!  We shared pizza and carbonara and very much enjoyed our dinner!

Yb_XgO8sN1rqxYomVV4vaA.text: The ambience is great with a relatively friendly staff for service.The food is not bad too, considering the price! The carbonara can be missed, and the steak should be ordered rare, nothing more than that. My friends and I ordered a medium rare steak and it was a little too tough even then, so please get a rare steak or nothing at all!The calamari is good, with a really light and fluffy batter which compliments the juicy soft squid in it.Overall, a more than above-average place for affordable fine dining.

photos.caption: Photo of Rocca - London, United Kingdom. Steak, cooked medium rare, with salad and fries.
Photo of Rocca - London, United Kingdom. Steak, cooked medium-rare.

-X_JDLNumIFSIB0FDjoihw.text: Great food. Pizza americano ( gourmet pepperoni), bolognese, frutti de mare pasta all delicious and less than 40 gbp for food and drink for my family of 5. Very nice setting and good service.

553buj5SDqpFLfhxIdHCZQ.text: Cheap and delicious! I got the bolognese and was happy with it. Service is also good. The pizza also looked really good but I didn't have enough stomach space.

rlSCdkqeMTqZ6apI9c-Zdg.text: There's surprisingly quite a few Italian places in the area.  My wife and I have tried a couple and Rocca is certainly our favorite.  The service was friendly and attentive.  The atmosphere is buzzing but relaxed.  And most importantly the food is delicious but reasonably priced considering the area.

KXxnAFAP7WXBWaaciaJU7w.text: Great all rounded restaurant, better to book otherwise you will probably have to wait. The food, especially the pizza is very good, thing crust pizza with tasty toppings, perfect balance between soft and crisp. The wine is decent too, as is the desert menu. Service has always been on top form. The price is something else, probably one of the best deals in town!

_hLoCVQ3xvUtxRX_H9k7ww.text: In London and was looking for somewhere...so yelped and this came up. Timed it perfectly and got there early as by the time we left...it was packed! Again, went with the family, so any review I write with the family is always going to be different from reviewing on a "special night out" with my wife! So...from the family friendly perspective, they were good. Nice portions, good tasting food...classic Italian. I had the steak which I am guessing was a sirloin. Found the rosemary a little overpowering but they cooked it nicely. The lasagne was clearly made in house and although a little cheesy was great for my son. Pizza was "better than fine" (wife commentary) but not fantastic. Honestly didn't know whether to rate 3 or 4 stars...but in comparison to my other 4 star rates...it is a high 3!!

aHht4irdKcwVfsFeb3-0Nw.text: Very good pizza.  We got take away twice in our 10 day stay in South Kensington.  Both times, the place was packed.

UT3eod0jmPmT_Iwuz45Drg.text: Rocca surprised me on several counts: reasonably inexpensive, decently prepared Italian food in South Ken.  I mean.  It could have just been terrible and touristy or way more expensive, but it's neither and it's somewhere I'd most likely go again.  The menu is pretty straightforward and is nothing you won't have seen elsewhere, but the proof is in the pudding and the pudding is this case is, in fact, not just pudding but inclusive of multiple courses.In short: I had the calamari and tagliatelle bolognese.  What can I say, I was feeling particularly British that day.  In the end, I could've done without the calamari as it was pretty non-descript.  Like, it wasn't bad, it was just kind of...meh.  The bolognese was pretty good though.  The ragu was rather flavourful and decent quality for £7.50. Although other reviewers thought the service was a bit haphazard, it was fine for us (and we had a group of 12 to boot) and they were pretty chatty too.  I think Rocca is pretty decent for the price.  It's cheaper than Carluccio's (and most other restaurants in a similar range) and the food is not far off in terms of quality (whilst being far above the restaurants below it).  That said, there are a few other places of better quality with comparable prices (Nuraghe in Tufnell Park springs to mind), although the latter is in Zone 2, not in a prime renting zone.   Still, Rocca is a good addition to SK and worth a return trip.

WkCzuoMPFzct6qguDXUmDg.text: My mom and I got tired of pub food on our visit to London, and this was the perfect change.We split a bottle of wine and started with an order of bread and a buffalo mozzarella and tomato salad. The bread was warm and mostly very soft (there were a couple of different kinds) and had delicious, grassy (in a good way) olive oil with balsamic vinegar for dipping. The salad was more of a warm tomato sauce, served with slices of toasted bread, a chunk of mozzarella, and olives and basil for garnish. Very good.I ordered the pasta carbonara, and my mom got a seafood pasta dish. Mine was a bit rich (my own fault for ordering carbonara, I think), but otherwise great - the pasta was the perfect texture. I tried the seafood pasta, and it was wonderful, with a not-too-light/not-too-heavy sauce and tons of seafood in it.We got a scoop of strawberry sorbetto to finish, and it was sweet but light and excellent.I was amazed by how good the prices were compared to other places we'd eaten. The atmosphere was nice but not too stuffy or fancy. Definitely worth a visit if you want something a little different and are in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Rocca - London, United Kingdom. Pasta pescatore
Photo of Rocca - London, United Kingdom. Pasta carbonara

2LTn5ETtNcOpOfEczx0Xrw.text: Very friendly service, the pizza was delicious! My wife ordered the squid ink crab meat pasta (also very tasty). To top it off it's very affordable considering the atmosphere and location.

photos.caption: Photo of Rocca - London, United Kingdom. Prosciutto pizza and squid ink pasta with crab meat
Photo of Rocca - London, United Kingdom. Street Entrance

hIyFvkGHcwgXjaXkbdQv0A.text: Tired of traditional Pub food, we hit up Yelp for some suggestions.  After a long day in Bath and as visitors from Chicago, we decided to look for some Italian food options. Rocca came up in the top 10 and was close to our flat in the Chelsea Embankment area. Without a reservation, our party of six ventured into the packed Tuesday night dinner crowd. No idea if we could even get a table. The manager smiled, welcomed us, and told us it would be a ten minute wait, a very pleasant surprise...Yelp reviews payoff. Great service, good food, and very well priced. Would recommend.

rC7aff_YKu3MmxBnJ5q1pw.text: Rocca is really close to The Kensington Hotel and the South Kensington tube stop. The food is really good and the ambiance is casual. I had the prosciutto pizza and a Pino Grigio. I would highly recommend it. The service is a little slow, but the waitress was very friendly.

LopIFC1XANoyMNdyYWH4mQ.text: This was a great Yelp discovery.  With its close proximity from the South Kensington tube station, it is easy peasy to get there.  We wandered in around 2100 on a Friday night and although the restaurant was busy we were able to get a table straight away. We skipped the starters.  I ordered the beef lasagna and my husband had the tagliatelle bolognese.  Our food came out quickly and tasted excellent!  The pasta here is prepared daily and it is very evident in the taste.  The prices are extremely reasonable, both entrees were under £9 each.  We finished our dinner with a piece of tiramisu for £5, a generous sized portion.  Service was friendly and fast.  Of note, service charge is not included on the bill so you will need to add on if desired.

photos.caption: Photo of Rocca - London, United Kingdom. Lasagna with beef ragu, excellent and good size.
Photo of Rocca - London, United Kingdom. Tagliatelle bolognese with fresh Parmesan cheese.
Photo of Rocca - London, United Kingdom. Birra Moretti, the only beer that I saw on the menu.  An Italian beer not too strong, good taste.

mUy7EvtPDitoVtt2FB27og.text: If you're looking for simple but delicious Italian food, this is the perfect place!! I love the setting - it's simple but also super pleasant to be in. The food was also incredible - definitely one of the top 5 Italian meals I've had in my life. We started with the cucumber tomato salad which came with the perfect vinaigrette and was delicious with beans. We then had the rigatoni pomodoro and margherita which were super flavorful and tasted really fresh despite being dishes that are often boring or overlooked. Finally, we had the lemon cheesecake which was great (and I'm really picky about cheesecake). I would definitely be back!!

dtF9YXRl91x04ZOMVzEW1g.text: We stopped in here on our first night in London at the recommendation of the front desk staff at our hotel. We figured the place must be good when it was packed at 8pm on a Thursday night. We quickly got a table for two. Ordered a bottle of wine. We started with the arrancini (my favorite) and the calamari. Both were excellent. We then split two pasta dishes. I had the seafood and risotto and my husband had the bolognese. Both were fantastic and filling. We finished the meal with the Affogato which was incredible and the chocolate cake. It was such a delicious meal to start our trip. We were intrigued at the prices. It was much cheaper than food here in the states and much better. Will definitely come back the next time we are back in London.

VUBwyqN-yq_WBJUtdsPVKw.text: During my trip to London with my wife we went to Rocca di Papa several times because the food was very good, relatively inexpensive and the dining space very cozy and comfortable, conveniently located near the South Kensington station. The food we've found is on par in terms of quality and taste with what we've had on our various trips to Italy. We had their Margherita pizza, seafood Risotto and pasta with Bolognese sauce and wholeheartedly enjoyed all of our meals.

24jlx9yfeg0DuX6fCjeeag.text: I'm confused on the super high ratings on this one. The service was pretty bad, made worse by the weird price fixe menu dinner happening directly to our left...something I never really figured out. We were unsure who our server was the whole time, and spoke to 4 different people throughout the course of the meal. We ordered the buscatini app and it was ok, but short on bread. The pizza was not bad, but not 5/5 stars either. I might return, but with all the options in London, this won't be at the top of my list.

ea2rxVBpWEn3v4XeHiGXgA.text: Bucatini with sausage and Rissotta Pesci with saffron. Both delicious. I t is a cute restaurant not far from the south Kensington tube station in London. The decor is welcoming and cozy feel. Good service too.

photos.caption: Photo of Rocca - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Rocca - London, United Kingdom

igNqbFx9XpHmNCP1Ks6Cew.text: On our last night in London, we came here for dinner with our friends who live nearby. The ambiance was great. The food was amazing and very reasonable. My 20 year old son had a pasta dish which he finished before any of us had finished out meal. The waiter asked if he'd like another portion and brought him an additional plate. THAT doesn't happen very often. Would definitely come here again.

KnFVogu0GqA1EUj_GGAjhQ.text: Came into Kensington, stayed at a hotel around the corner, yelp-ed and located Rocca.  Two of us walked in around 8-ish without a reservation and we were seated right away despite what looked to be a fairly full house.  We ordered the arancini, the caprese, and the buccatini alla pescatora.  The arancini was sooo good-crunchy crust, flavorful rice and cheese.  The caprese was very good-the mozzarella was so silky smooth!  The buccatini  was absolutely delicious-nice pasta that was aldente with a little chew, the mussels and clams were perfect, the shrimp delicious; we even asked for bread to sop up the sauce it was that good! We fast forward three days later and, looking for a place close to the hotel (already tried a couple of places in the area we returned to Rocca with another guest.  There were several large parties there but they managed to find a table for us.  This time we had the arancini, the funghi pizza, the ravioli all'ossobucco, and the buccatini again.  Nothing was short of fantastic, the pizza had such depth in the mushrooms, the ravioli was so rich and satisfying.One thing we do have to say. . . with such good food we were stuffed by the end of our meals and we never did have the room to try their desserts!Many thanks, Rocca, for your great service (wait staff were VERY cordial on both visits) and tremendous food!

photos.caption: Photo of Rocca - London, United Kingdom. buccatini alla pescatora
Photo of Rocca - London, United Kingdom. Arancini
Photo of Rocca - London, United Kingdom. Caprese-tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, olives

8anwuTeJnP-_A_GDrBzx8Q.text: Very nice Italian food at wonderfully reasonable prices- my food was no more than £10 altogether! I got the burrata, presented nicely on the plate with a ring of pesto, and two crostini (could have had a few more of those). It tasted rich and buttery, absolutely lovely. Next I got the aubergine bake which was just as rich with layers of aubergine, tomato sauce and mozzarella. Very filling. My husband and friends enjoyed their pizzas. The wine is also priced well and the white was a lovely dry. For both of us about £35 including drinks. Not bad at all.

photos.caption: Photo of Rocca - London, United Kingdom. The aubergine bake
Photo of Rocca - London, United Kingdom. The burrata

V-kqoeds2x7GmkaPX6kMtQ.text: First off, i note that this is a charming spot, with a rustic Italian décor that's also a bit elegant.  But the place is casual and the staff are all very hospitable, something we've observed in all London restaurants.  Since the place was rated so highly, we meandered off from our usual Italian hangout in Kensington.  We'd have to say that the food was a tad better at our other place, which surprised me given the high ratings here.  Still, we'd come back again to try other menu items.

8JPhAjnRmQj4jJxtBQv_Ng.text: Great italian in a great location.  The bacon and goat cheese salad is not to be missed!

-kIZwFYXTwN967c9ixVCiA.text: This was 1 block away from our hotel in Kensington and the food was superb. Not too loud and we were seated quickly. I enjoyed the grilled Branzino very much. Excellent service and good wine. No reservation since it was a Monday night. Fair price for sit down Italian restaurant!!! Highly recommended.

u-LuESwt7he8fBIIAGWQvQ.text: After a day of walking tour around London we stumble upon Rocca and I could not be happier. The price is vey reasonable for decent Italian food and I could not have ask for better atmosphere. The waitstaff was very friendly in assisting us on wine and food selection. We ordered: calamari, pizza with ham, squid ink tagliolini with crab, and panna cotta for dessert. Our least favorite as the calamari, it was undercooked and the accompany sauce does nothing favorable for the dish. Pizza was delicious, crust was baked nicely and the topping was phenomenal. The tagliolini with crab was the highlight of dinner, the pasta was al dente and the buttery crab sauce that it was in was just mind blowing. The panna cotta was good with raspberry sauce, I just wish they would spend a little bit more time on the presentation of the food.

BJkUzimc7LTsXNT1KwrI5Q.text: I got the Rigatoni and it was undercooked and hard. The service was ok they did not speak English very well, which made it hard to order.

Y_5tOvRdnStdY7-W_cWlzQ.text: Very tasty food. The wait staff was delightful and attentive to our children. Highly recommended!!

jYPJFiWQ_Oi8JnDdZyXw8g.text: We went here on our first day in London and stumbled upon it while exploring near our hotel. We had the steak with chips (14.35GBP) and tagliolini with white cornish crab meat (8.75GBP). The staff was not super friendly and service could have been better but the food was good! The pasta was al dente, fresh, non-greasy, seasoned, and had a generous amount of crabmeat. The only downside was the pieces of shell that were tossed in. If that wasn't there, the food would get 5 stars. I had a small amount of steak and it was also on point. Many places do not season their food in England but this steak had tons of flavor. If you want authentic Italian for cheap, try Rocca!

photos.caption: Photo of Rocca - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Rocca - London, United Kingdom. Steak
Photo of Rocca - London, United Kingdom. Tagliolini with crab

hj4QUZGs42uU1UM1yMn1zA.text: We greatly enjoyed our dinner. We found the restaurant on Yelp and it was within easy walking distance from our hotel on Cromwell St.  We had Linguine Carbonese and Ravioli with Calamari starter. We were extremely pleased with all dishes. We had the D'Abuzzo wine with it and that was a great suggestion from the server.  Service was excellent and provided by several servers.  Very reasonably.priced and a very pleasant evening. Started getting very busy as we were leaving but we had no trouble getting seated or served properly. We may even dine here again before our 2 week holiday is finished!  Highly recommend!

nncEWX8TX5dae1OdAr8Azg.text: Great restaurant with excellent service.  Good vibe.  Came for a quick meal one night and ended up coming three nights in a row.  Fresh pasta with fresh sauces.  Prices are also reasonable.  Waiters were friendly and helpful.

sa6XovwWZ1bbWg1-xtRmdQ.text: Mediocre Italian food but not expensive so at least we did not waste a lot of money. I got the pesto pasta and pesto was flavorless and pasta was a bit dry. Pizza was just okay, nothing to write home about.

lO9X3NU_FLwyaM4E57a20g.text: In the past I was massively anti-Rocca.  I attended a number of anti-Rocca protests, and even showed up there in a balaclava, demanding they get their shit together.Well, my two year long campaign of terror must've struck a cord because Rocca is now pretty damn good. We go often, my daughter eating a pizza while my wife and I down glasses of wine, trying to cram in a relationship before 7pm when our child must be home to sleep, the stress of which takes a deep toll.My grilled chicken was fantastic, as were the accompanying chips.  My wife has a risotto which was quite good as well though risotto is a bit of a gamble for like 12 quid.Staff all super nice and welcoming and good to da kids.
